@davearthur wow, I haven't heard that one in a long time - what a beautiful song. Can't help hearing "when the smiles were Genoan" though
@Singyamatokun that is EXACTLY what I had in mind!
@Singyamatokun I'd probably bottle it and use the road. Is it possible to keep feet dry without deploying 'the goose'?
@cuckoojar haha yes they did! I shouted a cheery thank you to the guy as he got back in the truck. The novelty was wearing off a little
That puddle was great while it lasted. My preferred method of attack was the 'goose coming in to land'. Perhaps it'… https://t.co/Rh5IrprcJ5
@BrendaPuech sorry to hear that, Brenda

@justinmckie @roadcc @MPSCamdenTnSgt we have covered Camden Police op, but probably should have mentioned in this story, too
By me: West Mids Police close pass op could be rolled out to 16 forces. Is yours one? #cycling https://t.co/dT1Owcp1kU via @roadcc
@OwenRogers @r_baruch Wmids police tell me they spent time with @metpoliceuk separately on this. Met's contention LDN traffic moves too slow

@HumberbeatRoads do you have a contact for your press office? Can't see on website. Am a journalist with enquiry. Thank you in advance
Great news from Cambridge - thousands more ppl cycling now on two roads with protected cycle routes https://t.co/YfGrSSw9bM

@hackneycouncil great to see; used to live very close to this crossing & use regularly, with trepidation; some v dodgy driving around there!
@dean9476 @hackneycouncil actually you pay Vehicle Excise Duty, which is a polluter's tax; roads are paid for from general taxation, in fact
@RantyHighwayman I never take cabs, and I didn't write that RMT presser - ask the RMT!
I just saw a guy wipe his finger on a snowy car as he walked past and put it in his mouth, without pausing #uksnow
@fussellface so long as you get home before midnight; after that you'll need skis on your pumpkin
I knew it! At least I hoped it. TfL are using mini road sweep vans to de-ice the cycle superhighways. Safe home all… https://t.co/lWNOrS0cK8

@SpacePootler ha! thanks. The Afsluitdijk kind of blew me away, like: they have bike lanes EVERYWHERE. That's the point, v few network gaps

@LdnGreenCycles @LPSullivan @TfL I sense some sort of challenge brewing here ... grit showdown? If they're out of the shed anyway...

...they actually say they'll keep cycle superhighways clear, which could just be a person with a shovel

I caught the Adventure Syndicate's @CarbonCycleKate before she headed for the high seas: If I Can Cross Continents by Bike, Anyone Can

I should get a cap to go under my helmet so I can look a bit cooler next to you two @HartleyCycles @moveon2wheels

@charltonbrooker it was brilliant.
Happy Christmas all https://t.co/OfyulgYsk1
And thank you @pewseyvelo for helping me with brake realigning and a caffeinated energy gel after all that mud! You've a lovely shop

@wyadvd @roadcc @SpokesLothian On new London cycle superhighways that left traffic lane would be held while cyclists had green & vice versa

@_AmyMartin_ report says because no legal protection from turning traffic councils r unwilling to risk innovation & build stop-start stuff
